meanings.definition: A person who complains constantly or habitually.
meanings.sent1: The kvetchers in the office always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother is one of the kvetchers in the family, always grumbling about something.
meanings.sent3: The group of kvetchers at the park made a game out of finding things to whine about.
meanings.sent4: The kvetchers were like broken records, repeating their complaints over and over.
meanings.sent5: The image of the kvetchers with clouds above their heads perfectly captured their constant complaining.

meanings.sent1: We invited all the kvetchers to the meeting to hear their feedback.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with kvetchers, each with their own list of grievances.
meanings.sent3: The kvetchers gathered around the water cooler, turning complaints into conversation.
meanings.sent4: The kvetchers stood out in the crowd, their grumbling voices rising above the rest.
meanings.sent5: The parade of kvetchers marched through the streets, voicing their discontent for all to hear.
